author: cob20

text: Actually, Top Spin doesn't suck. It is just a lot of players use it wrong that makes people hate it. You don't fling your self into foes, you just don't want to make a lot contact with the enemy as it takes less energy. While not as bad as people make it out to be, it is pretty unpredictable. That idea of the Top Spin sounds better though.

author: skyehi 262

text: No, you're not the only one. I've thought the two sounded similar since I first heard "Burn." (I heard this first.) Many Japanese video game music composers were influenced by Deep Purple, so it's hardly surprising. Between this, the final boss music from Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island, and the boss battle music from Blue Dragon, Deep Purple's influence kinda shows through, regardless of the era. (And, on an unrelated note, Deep Purple has an album coming out at the end of April.)

text:
Back from a nice couple days with family I hadn't seen in a while. Makes for big filled days, which is far from relaxing but worth it when it's with people you care about.

I've always liked the buzzing instrument used in this theme (like at 0:20). I think I've uploaded my 3 favorite robot themes now from this game: Snake Man, Spark Man and this one.
author: SupraDarky
